instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message:
No green light, no fan spin.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 8.19 V

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
1: 0V
2: 14.71
3: 3.98
9:0.03
12: 2.76
13: 0
14: 2.65-2.73
15: 0.05 V

17: 8.19
18: 8.15
17-18 RES: 3.4 O

19: 5.10
20: 5.08

27: 14.57
28: 14.57
27-28 RES: 20 O

<RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>: PIN 1 14.58V

No getting <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> so no power to SMC?


<CHIP>U7090</CHIP>
6: 14.88V
No shorts

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message:
Don't you want to know voltage on pin 8 too?

Check <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>/96 and <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR>.
Be sure no short, nor low value on L7095.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7090</CHIP>
8: 14.98V

<RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>: 230kO PIN 2: 1.25V
<RESISTOR>R7096</RESISTOR>: 190 kO
<CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR>: 0.215 uF


L7095: PIN 2: 2.82V
No short: diode mode: 0.312V at L7095

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message:
First, remove <CAPACITOR>C7095</CAPACITOR>.
If still the same, change <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message:
Remove <CAPACITOR>C7095</CAPACITOR> and not replace it?

What do you think is going on?

this is a feedback line correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message: Feedback pin is to "close" to 3V42; maybe cap lekage, or corrosion near <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message:
genius!

changed <CAPACITOR>C7095</CAPACITOR>, green light, no fan spin
next changed <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>....fan spin!!!

boots into OS

spent another 1/2 hr changing a fan connector with a missing latch but it now works!!!!

thank you!!!!!!!
